Reviews.Title: “If you expect a real 5* hotel in Berlin, avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: SWcritic
Reviews.Content: If you are seeking a real 5 stars hotel in Berlin, the "Hotel de Rome" should not be your choice. If you want your room to be made, you have someday to ask it twice. The night service ? Forget about it. We stayed 5 days : the night service was not even made once. You travel with children ? Ok, they can guarantee you a connecting room, and that is a good thing. But everything in that mather stops here. As the front door, the welcome your receive each time you walk in is not the one you can expect in a 5 stars hotel. Some of the rooms you can rent are like a basketball hall : high ceiling, but every sound is like a nasty noise in a cathedral. Some parts of the hotel seem not to be have cleaned the last two weeks. It is a real shame. You may think that these kinds of "stuff" are not a problem for you. You are the judge, but keep in mind that you are supposed to be in a 5 stars hotel. It was clear in my mind that you can just not compare a London 5 stars with a Berlin 5 stars hotel, but here the difference is just too big not to tell it. Try to eat at the hotel restaurant, the "Parioli", and you will find out what kind of hotel you are staying in. The deco is nice but... If like eating out in fast food, this restaurant can be for you, except for the bill. We were there with a family of 3, and by paying 350 Euro, we expected to have some quality food. Forget it at the Parioli. I don't want to describe here the quality of the food, it was so awful. My advice here is simple : avoid booking a room in that hotel. Continue to browse through the tripadvisor website to find a better one. I will never book this hotel once again, but I will also never book a hotel with the same brand in the rest of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonKiwigal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular from the lobby and the service is unbeatable. The only thing that let it down was the high priced internet and the lack of quality outfitting in the bedroom. Aside from that this was a very pleasant business trip to Berlin. The location is great, walking distance to restaurants and all my meetings. Seriously fantastic staff - very helpful. The advertised price however was far too expensive - we had a corporate discount which made it reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (Bebelplatz, Gendarmenmarkt), great service”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lotus
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very good quality product, typical of the Rocco Forte group. The rooms here can feel a bit weird, given that this building used to house a bank (i.e., very, very high ceilings), but apart from that, it's pretty perfect. The room was spacious, furnishings were of good quality, the bathroom was big and shiny and had everything we needed. Was very happy with the finishings in general. Can't beat large windows looking over the church on Bebelplatz. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant staff were helpful, but perhaps a little more training might not go amiss. They felt a little inexperienced and some requests would take ages to be dealt with. But they were always polite and chatty. The pool is nice - it occupies what used to be the bank's vault. And they have swimsuits for guests to borrow. (Who packs a swimsuit for a city break?) The location is directly onto Bebelplatz (famous for the book burnings in the 1930s) and Gendarmenmarkt is around the corner (where there was a christmas market when we visited). Unter den Linden (shopping street, and main thoroughfare leading to many sights, including museums) is just across the square.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Rushaniya
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situation in the very heart of the historical part of Berlin. It is very clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff at the reception gave us a warm Welcome and followed all the 5 star Hotel standards. Good variety of food at the breakfast and very friendly and smiling service. Also we forgot our wallet with money and all the credit cards an the safe box in the room. We were contacted immediately. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The only disappointment is absence of free Wi-Fi. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Newish on the block”
Reviews.Author: hunger4d
Reviews.Content: We could not have been made to feel more at home in this centrally placed hotel, an ideal base from which to visit the many museums, churches and historic sites most of which are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doralynn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Rome is in the middle of Mittte, about 10 minutes walk from the Museum Island, right off Unter den Linden, and opposite the Opera House. The rooms and bathrooms are spectacular and large. I can't think of a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just THE ONE to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LuGarcia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel The Rome (a Rocco Forte hotel) last november by myself and had a wonderful time there. It´s a small hotel with such a wonderful service, from the bell boy to the salles manager. The location cannot be better, on the heart of Berlin. The room (stayed in a jr suite) has a great size, and a wonderful bathroom (which for me gives or takes points to any hotel). The breakfast is huge and delicious. A great way to start your day. Something that got my attention: the number of familied with kids at the hotel. It´s because kids are very wellcome at the hotel, which includes lots of special activities for the litte ones. Definitly will go back and recomend it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Taniushka
Reviews.Content: I have spent 5 nights at this hotel and it was simply perfect. Location isb great, all the staff is super friendly, and the GM was always around. I arrived around 10pm and he was there greeting everybody, and next morning 8am he was supervising the breakfast. This is one of the reasons why the service is so good in this hotel. Room, amenities, services, staff...location. All perfect. And the breakfast was one of the best I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Rocco Forte at his best”
Reviews.Author: Clive G
Reviews.Content: This part of Berlin (Mitte) is a bit corporate - all the big chains are here and the bland modern hotel boxes abound with the usual names attached to the facades. Hotel de Rome is as central as the rest but in an interesting building. Wander away from the main communal areas to get a sense of the grandeur of the original building. Service is as you would expect from a Rocco Forte hotel (exemplary) albeit at a price. However we got a great three days for two deal, and a complimentary upgrade without asking - great value. It's expensive but good value.. Niggles - we couldnt find any.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel and great Bar”
Reviews.Author: AndyRandy
Reviews.Content: The stay was very nice, room super! The Bar and the whole team at the Bar are outstanding! I really recommend it!! But!! The reception staff is not at all friendly, they where so greedy and strange as well the unfriendly and arrogant treatment, because of that I will not stay there anymore, its sad that such a nice hotel has the worst reception staff I have ever seen in a 5* hotel! As well Internet WiFi its o expensive! I will go back to the Hyatt or Sofitel on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: CWIN
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. In a really great position. Our room was enormous with everything you could wish for. The bathroom was fantastic too. Breakfast was wonderful.....there was nothing that you could not get to eat!! Cocktail bar very good. Consierge was particularly helpful with booking restaurants for us to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: afehr
Reviews.Content: I stay in Hotel de Rome for the new years period for 7 nigths. The hotel is very well located, near everything. The decor it s sober but very nice. Good food and the service exelent especially the concierges.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Propertyking2000
Reviews.Content: Well as a loyal Adlon fan for almost six years - it came as a fantastic surprise when I chose to stay here. Just superb in every way. My suite (upgrade) was superb, exemplary service, and stunning common parts. Stay here if you can possibly afford it...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel excellent location but lacking something”
Reviews.Author: cosift
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in June 2011. The rooms are pristine and well kept with every convenience and facility. The level of service is high and the skills and helpfulness of the concierge desk superior. The doormen were fantastic in getting cabs and greeting guests and giving a great welcome. The staff in the breakfast room were extremely efficient, friendly, and helpful and the standard of cuisine excellent. The location for a tourist in Berlin is great and there are many good quality local restaurants. When the Opera House re-opens this will make the location even more attractive to those interested in this form of culture. Prior to booking I thought about the Adlon but was talked into the De Rome by my travel agent. While not sorry for this decision, the moment I walked into the Adlon I could feel the weight of history on me and loved it. Those sink into chairs, the old fashioned lights, the woodwork, etc provided an ambience that was really lacking at the De Rome. While one can see its history (including the bullet marks on the stony exterior) somehow the Adlon seemed to devour one with its past. This was reinforced when I had dinner at the Lorenz Adlon Restaurant. I can't comment on the Adlon rooms but having a drink in the foyer prior to dinner at the Lorenz was enough to convince me to stay at the Adlon next time.

Reviews.Title: “simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jandsboston
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 days in october in an absolutely gorgeous suite. truly understated luxury, great in room amenities, quietly elegant public spaces, and the friendliest, most accommodating staff imaginable with no pretensions - all i saw were smiles, all i heard was "of course". what a refreshing take on luxury in a fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: ROTCHKO
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel in town. A former bank with some spectacular details. Some of the rooms really nice, some less charming. Breakfast just ok, SPA small, but nice, a good chance to relax. Part of the decor of the hotel without style (What the sense of that big red vases???) but the building has a charme. The location is nice, close to someof the best concept stores and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Details are everything”
Reviews.Author: onlyGeorgeVwilldo
Reviews.Content: With 5 star hotel you get of course a beautiful room with all the trimmings, so what makes the difference is the details. There are nice touches, like a couple of books in the spacious room, but the king size bed is hard (does it have something to do with Mr Forte Italians origins? Italian beds are seldom comfy). The room is spacious (we had 518-519) and feels 'designy' but the bed lights should be replaced with something more practical. The room has no 'Berlin' feel and you could be anywhere in the world. Bathroom has all the trimmings. Wifi is not included in the room and it gets expensive in this day and age where people have often several smarphones, laptops and so on, but cannot get access for several devices. The staff at check-in was friendly and we did the paperwork in the room itself, but one night we were surprised to go to the room around 10pm and find out that the turn-down service was on the way. Isn't that a bit late?

Reviews.Title: “BEST BERLIN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bestmilano
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay. Hotel in historic building, centrally located and quiet. Upon arrival I was assigned a room that was not to my liking and the staff very kind to me has been accompanied in another room very spacious and with a view of the surrounding monuments. The rooms are very comfortable, very clean, room service is impeccable, the bed comfortable and the linens same. The modern bathroom with separate bath from shower, a large shower very comfortable. Spacious lobby, the restaurant one of the very best of Berlin, to each request concierge, spa with sauna, turkish bath and a large heated swimming pool. One of the most unusual indoor pools where he swam, very scenic and sexy:)) The bar has good drinks, very nice guy at the bar with me taste of his own accord a liquor never tried before. In your room bottle of red wine, fruit, chocolate and a welcome note. The corridors of the hotel are very spacious with high ceilings. A hotel in every respect, I visited several other hotels in Berlin, and frankly I think is the best of all.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average old bank building!”
Reviews.Author: wockinwod
Reviews.Content: Had one night in this hotel as part of a trip through Germany. I was excited to visit Berlin and see all it had to offer. We were met at the airport by the hotel car and efficiently driven straight to the hotel. It is very well located in the heart of Berlin and within walking distance of the main attractions and station. Check-in was a slightly prolonged affair as we asked to be shown a couple of other room types other than the one we had booked. We settled on Room 101 (which from what I understand is the second best room in the hotel). It has an imposing giant double door as its entry and is in the original part of the hotel. It is interesting to think of the conversations and meetings that were held in this grand room when it was the Dresner Bank. The entry leads into a magnigicent lounge area which is covered in beautiful wood panelling everywhere, including the ceiling. This is contrasted with some funky modern lounge chairs and a dining table. The bedroom is also a generous size with a king bed, again in a modern style. Bathroom was a good size and had a separate washroom, complete with bidet, which could also be accessed from the entry. The highlight had to be that we dicided to host some friends for dinner in the suite. They set up a table for six people respendant with tablecloth and all the trimmings. The food orders were from the in-room dining menu (which was very reasonably priced I have to add) and served by one member of staff. They did a fantastic job and nothing was too much trouble. We did also try the bar which was not too bad but not sensational. Perhaps this was marred by a rude member of the bar staff. Overall an amazing property steeped in history. Would loved to have lolled around in the suite for a day or two more!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, as you would expect from Rocco Forte”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: Location: very convenient / in center Ambience: very cool place, one feels privileged to stay in this hotel. The feeling is of aristocracy but without any arrogance Value: very reasonable, similar hotel in other major European city would cost double Room: spacious, all amenities Service: near perfect. They also try to add a personal touch, memorizing your name. bellboys fast and efficient too. Reception: fast, efficient, knowledgeable. My credit card did not work for some reason, they tried 3x without getting annoyed (as often happens in many hotels), eventually finding an acceptable solution Breakfast: high quality food, you enjoy what you eat Airport transportation: they met met in Tegel Airport with a name shied. Professional driver in a nice, clean Mercedes Overall: Superb hotel, as you would expect from Rocco Forte

Reviews.Title: “Clean and welcoming at a great location”
Reviews.Author: MDMOMLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: What a pretty hotel! I felt pampered the whole of my stay. Warm entryway appreciated in cold weather. Room was comfortable. Italian linen sheets on firm mattress. Bathroom was larger than my bath at home! Separate shower and tub. Shower had rainfall head and handheld wand. Lighting in bath was great. Appreciated wake up call setting on the tv. Restaurant was warm and welcoming. Hot chocolate delicious after short walk to meaningful Holocaust Memorial and Brandenburg Gate. You can easily walk to the Tiergarten and enjoy a stroll on Under den Linden. Then return to the hotel and relax. Roof garden looks amazing but closed in winter. My only ding is e high price for wi fi. I really expect it to be complimentary for guests.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PROPERTY & MATCHING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Rome for an extended week-end in early october, our first time in the capital city of Germany. Although I always wanted to stay at Hotel Adlon, I did not select it in the end, the style of decor kind of put me off, too german 1930s middle class as I see it. I Was happy I did, as I discovered that it was unification day, and the Pariserplatz aera would have been an absolute mess. On the other hand, Hotel de Rome is situated a 10-minute walk away from Pariser Platz, off Unter den Linden, both extremely quiet and close to everything really, that is except the West part of town. We checked in a little bit early. It was a breeze and our room was nevertheless ready. We had a Junir Suite on the top floor, 512 is memory serves me well, located at the side of the hotel, overlooking Edwigskatedral (windows open, we could hear the roaring organ during mass), and the TV tower a little in the distant. Pretty large accommodation . large foyer with storage, big room with king bed, 2 armchairs, sofa, desk, and chest of drawers. Large bathroom with heated floors, separate shower stall no enclosed toilet. Loved the toiletries, and found the Rocco Forte logo on the slippers and robes stylish, for what it is worth. Excellent lighting everywhere. Reproachless soundproofing. The overall style of the hotel is a killer. Mixture of understated colors with bright accents, beautuful textures, Four Seasons style flowers. All contained in a historic building looking perfectly ay place with its new destination as a hotel. We thought they did a great job at renovating the place. Really top tier, on a par with the best Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton or mandarin Oriental, with a little extra glitz. Great service . knowledgeable concierge did good restaurant recommendations, and reservations ; only wished they had let their hot vibe go loud, but perhaps they are too German, and/or we feel too conservative. Spa is beautiful, for what we tried, namely the changing facilities and the swimmimg pool, set up in the ancient safe room. Worth a visit if only for the tiles ! Excellent breakfast, even when it was back to the normal fare on the monday, following the sunday brunch. Great buffet selection, along with a la carte. Only wished they would arrange the food on buffet in greater dishes. Would avoid the staff constantly checking on the supply, running for more, not avoiding the unavoidable momentary out of stock situation. The USP (top feature) of Hotel de Rome is the rooftop terrace. We were blessed by amazingly mild weather for october (24°C during day time), and took great advantage of it -when it was not hep for private parties (honesty has it, for a limited amount of time). It is set up with quality furniture and greeneries, high seating on stools or in plush sofas. Nice although limited drink menu, obviously sponsored by Veuve Clicquot champagne, not the worst of class. Nice and friendly attendants here too. Sipping champagne at dusk, with a commanding view over the roofs and monuments, was a highlight each day of our stay. They could possibly improve it, with later hours (think after dinner coffee/drink with a cigar), adding some gas heaters. I know this is Germany and not environmental friendly, but then, Germans are the ones speeding around in Mercs and Audis, not us ! Overall outstanding value for money, especially in the perspective of the pricing in the main capital cities of Europe (Paris and London at top). Could not recommend the place any warmlier.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: millionmiles09
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Rome is my favorite hotel in this world, excellent location in the best part of Berlin, service is absolutely first class from the moment you arrive to the one you leave there is always someone extremely professional and knowledgeable. Come for the second time and the doorman knows your name, the GM left you a note in the room, the concierges guess what you want. Absolutely amazing. It delivers the true feeling of being taken care of, think of something, someone will find it. If you can't think, they will do it for you. Have stayed at De Rome several times and am still amazed by the decor. All in all one of the best hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING *****”
Reviews.Author: Adst73
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and was blown away by everything about it. The reception is Amazing, beautifully designed and comfortable. The rooms are exactly the same, modern and comfortable. The food is excellent. I could not cult anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel but Average Service”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: Hotel del Rome is a very nice and centrally located boutique hotel, located across from Humbolt University. The hotel itself is housed in a historical building, so it has a lot of interesting design details. Location-wise, it is about a 30 minute ride from Tegel Airport, and about a 15-minute walk to the TV tower. There are many restaurants a few blocks away, and a main shopping street with high-end stores in about a 5-minute walk. The hotel is located away from the main streets, so it is relatively quiet. The hotel staff is very welcoming, from the doormen to the front desk. We arrived early from the United States, so our room wasn’t ready. We were able to change in the restrooms in the lobby and grab a quick bite at the restaurant before we headed out. There is also a bar in the lobby that has a nice atmosphere to it. The bar closes at 1AM, and they like to clean up a few minutes before hand, so don’t get there right at closing. We were on the 4th floor, Room 435, which had a nice balcony. The keycard has an RFI chip in it, so all you have to do to enter the room is pass the card by the doorknob. The entryway is fairly large, and there is a closet off to the left. The restroom is fairly large, with heated floors, heated towel rack, separate shower and bathtub, and a bidet. The bed was very comfy. There was also a TV in the room and a desk. The overall décor was very modern and comfortable. On the 4th Floor, there is a rooftop restaurant and bar, which can get packed on a nice day. It was very nice to eat and drink, while overlooking the relatively short Berlin skyline. There are many different types of seating areas, so guests can pick one that suits their mood. The food at the restaurant is the exact same menu as room service, and the prices are the same. The hotel has complimentary shoe shinning service, a spa, and a gym. The one drawback is that there is not an ironing board in the room. So if you want to get anything ironed, you have to go through housekeeping, which can get pretty expensive. Overall this hotel was decent, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very very poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: dagGothenburg_Sweden
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family for four nights at Hotel de Rome in Berlin and it was a truly disappointing experience. We have stayed many times at Rocco Forte Hotels in many cities and this was so far the worst experience. The SPA was filthy, dirty towels everywhere and no fresh towels available. The breakfast experience also bad. Waiving 15 minutes to get a y attention for staff and then waiting 15 minutes for a coffee. My wife ordered an omelette which was extremely dry and did not contain the ingrediebts she had asked for. I am also tired of the question when checking in; "how was your journey". I would rather like someone to ask "is there anything we can do for you to make your stay more comfortable". All in all very disappointing and the fact that they have so many external guests coming in to eat breakfast at the hotel so thtat they have to seat people in the lounge (!!) makes the experience even worse. But once again, the SPA area (sauna and pool) was a joke! I do hope Sir Roccoforte reads this review.....

Reviews.Title: “Looking for the best. If so stay here.”
Reviews.Author: sherman3
Reviews.Content: If you lik nice hotels with good service. Stay here. Nothing compares in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “So nice!!”
Reviews.Author: PascaleV
Reviews.Content: we booked 3 rppùs on the phone. Very helpful staff, and effcient. A week before our arrival I made some changes, and it went smoothly. We arrived very late and still could eat at the bar with live music. The rooms were perfect, large, comfortable, with a balcony, a nespresso machine, a large walk in closet... The pool was very nice, and I found the history of the hotel very interesting: It used to be a bank, you can still see the vault's door at the spa level! The breakfast is a treat, elegant, fresh, and the service perfect! (coffee to go on request )

Reviews.Title: “This is a truly amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: soapbox1964
Reviews.Content: I am fortunate to have stayed at some of the 'must do' hotels around the world and whilst usually these hotels deliver in the main, there is usually at least one minor thing that irks or just isn't quite right. Not so with the Hotel de Rome - it was perfection! From our initial contact with the concierge to our departure everything was just so. We were on holiday with our 11yo son and stayed in a classic suite. The suite was beautiful with a red and grey colour scheme. Plenty of room for the rollaway bed too. There was a tv in the living room and one in the bedroom which worked well for us, especially given the xbox 360 that was thoughtfully supplied for our DS's use! The suite had an enormous bathroom with an adjoining dressing room. I made contact with the concierge before our visit to get restaurant recommendations and arrange for some amenities to be in our room for our arrival. Communication was good, with emals responded to promptly and written in a friendly manner. Breakfast, which is included in the suite deal, was excellent a good range of buffet items with additional menu for eggs and other hot dishes. The location of the hotel is good, being close to Freidrichstrasse for shopping and close to Germandmenmarkt for restaurants and cafes. A two minute walk takes you t the Unter den Linden where the 100 bus takes you to the Zoo (and the K'dam) and to Alexanderplatz in the opposite direction. Museum island is about a five minute walk away. There are two underground stops within a few minutes walk too. We ate at a number of restaurants within walking distance if the hotel and the standard of food available was excellent. Berlin is a super City and the Hotel de Rome is a wonderful base from which to enjoy it! On a sunny evening, nothing beats a cocktail on the roof terrace watching the starlings swooping and flocking across the beautiful city vistas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stylish hotel with central location and great service - loved it.”
Reviews.Author: bettiblu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night while visiting friends in the city. Everything about the place was five-star and very slick, modern and stylish and not at all stuffy or full of itself. Great marble bathroom and stylish but minimally furnished bedroom - attention to detail everywhere. Nice live music late in the evening at the ground floor bar and great cocktails One tiny criticism though - the corridors and room all had that horrid cruise ship airless smell. They had opened the bedroom window before we got there but this did not fix the problem. This should not have been overlooked and was totally preventable as corridors did all have windows. Thoroughly recommend - can't think of anywhere I have liked more. Looks like I need to try the other Rocco Forte places.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to treat yourself too”
Reviews.Author: TerriLondon
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel as part of a business trip staying for two nights. It's in a great location for sightseeing and very easy to get to from the train stations. I came in from Schoenfeld and it only took about 40 minutes with just one change. The room itself was very large, the bed was big and very very comfortable! The bathroom was great - the shower is huge, very powerful and there is plenty of nice cosmetics to use :0) There's a safe and a well stocked mini bar, a proper hair dryer along with a large tv and lots of wardrobe space. I was on the 4th floor which is also where the roof top drinks terrace is. This was great and afforded really nice views. We had canapes and drinks - the food was delicious and the service excellent! The furniture up there was very comfortable and it would have been easy to spend a nice sunny evening up there. On our first day we had lunch in the restaurant - I have no idea about the cost but the food and service again were excellent. There is a nice garden area to that restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Could get used to this service level..”
Reviews.Author: Hildegull
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a central location and has very high standards. The building used to be a bank, but is now transformed into a hotel with a fantastic rooftop terrasse, a very nice inside bar, restaurant, business center and not least spacious, comfortable and very welcoming rooms. All is topped by very polite and smiling staff, that do their utmost to make my stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, & very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GlobalBen
Reviews.Content: Well furnished & modern, in a convenient & central part of Berlin. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkahn
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel set inside what was a bank before World War II. It is in a very grand style with modern dramatic furnishings. The location is excellent, in the Mitte section just a few steps from Unter den Linden. Our room was on the first floor with ceilings of about 20 feet. It was appointed brilliantly, with a fab walk in closet, very comfortable bed and a large and beautifully done bathroom. The style of the room is modern and a bit masculine. The staff were very accomodating especially the concierges Anna, Felix and Benjamin. Our breakfast was not included, but beware if yours is not, the breakfast buffet (which is gorgeous) cost 32 Euros a head. There are several cafes in the area which are good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Taking attention to detail to the next level”
Reviews.Author: Articulated_bedouin
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Rocco Forte hotel, and I must say the service was something else. I have stayed at many 5* properties, but the attention to detail the service staff provided takes you to the next level. The concierge managed to get us tickets for a sold out concert, on the SAME DAY ! without having to pay a HUGE premium. Hotel de Rome, I shall be visiting you soon !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: jeff1224
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the center of Berlin, with swimming pool, rooftop terrace, bar with live music, friendly staff, not so cheap but worth it

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!!”
Reviews.Author: jonnyelliot
Reviews.Content: I liked that hotel alot.. Great service and very clean!!! The rooms very nice!!! and i had i great weekend...! i probably go back one day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: emsy85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here fore three nights at the end of April. The room (a junior suite) was very spacious, well decorated and the bathroom lovely. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and professional. Food and drinks were great. the location very good for all the main tourist sites. I really could not fault this hotel at all we had a fantastic stay and will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: ThomasNyegaard
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews on Tripadvisor but having had a fantastic experience at Hotel de Rome, I feel compelled to write a brief comment. The hotel is, in my view, faultless. The location, decor, staff, and food are all absolute top notch. We were greeted by the friendliest of doorman, checked in quickly and seamlessly by excellent and courteous reception staff and got a fantastic room courtesy of division manager Christoph. Having arrived late, the staff were more than happy to serve dinner for us on the roofterrace despite being after closing hours. Throughout our stay the staff went out of their way to help and make our stay as pleasant as possible. The breakfast is just fantastic with all the fruits, cereals, juices etc. one can imagine. The concierges were very knowledgable and helpful. All in all, this hotel rates as one of the best I have stayed in and I would recommend anyone going to Berlin to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time”
Reviews.Author: Avrom
Reviews.Content: great breakfat, great concierge, top level service

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: mdvLondon
Reviews.Content: Loved this place... Big rooms, great service,Very helpful doormen , lively bar, Sumptuous food , perfect location for sightseeing and good for meetings too.. would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, slightly faded - but a gem”
Reviews.Author: jimlarky
Reviews.Content: This place does not look too much from outside, but that is the only real downside. The front office team are efficient; not in a BMW sort of way - but with real charm. The rooms are uniquely decorated, and although extras are quite pricey - I WILL return here on my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “mousy from the outside but really good inside!”
Reviews.Author: msspiderman
Reviews.Content: I was staying there for 2 nights in January and when our taxi was dropping us off we were surprised to see that in this small, quit street a hotel was located. But when the doorman opened the backdoor of our cab and welcomed us heartly we knew that this is going to be positive surprise. Same at the reception: very polite and professional! Our room was great, very well styled with a great bathroom. Flatscreen TV but WiFi only for a ridiculous fee. Breakfast buffet €35 and that's a rip-off. Honestly, the selection is very small and we have seen much, much better buffets for less money. Luckily enoug we had a corporate rate including breakfast and that's why we can say, that value was overall very good. The Spa area in the cellar looked ok but one wouldn't go there in summer, I suppose. Anyway, being close to the Gendarmenmarkt the location is great, staff is expectionally friendly and rooms are very good! I'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Service”
Reviews.Author: cherryRUk
Reviews.Content: Despite our late evening arrival our reception was swift,efficient,helpful and friendly and this approach proved to be the norm during our 3 night stay.We were dealt quickly and also with a warm smile.Particular praise must go to Concierge.We took up a considerable amount of time and not once did they show any signs of frustration or irritation.Truly professional service. Breakfast was beautifully presented,fresh and with a good variety of choice.Our room was spacious and spotless,if we did have a quibble it would be te lack of tea/coffee making facility in the rooms.After a couple of wild,wet,windswept days in the city,it would have just been nice to collapse with a hot drink instead of having to go to a cafe or into the bar area. The hotel is well situated and certainly in walking distance of key points of historical and architechtural interest.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MarcelloBrito
Reviews.Content: Its Simple: Hotel de Rome is by far, the best hotel in town. Everything is superb: Location, Design, Service, staff. I had a memorable stay. Wish return fast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Winter break”
Reviews.Author: Marta Hari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. We went to Berlin to visit old friends and do a bit of Christmas shopping. The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas, huge gingerbread house in lobby, Christmas tree and mistletoe bough over reception. The welcome was warm, the room was really comfortable and very large for a city hotel. The toiletries were by REN and everything I needed was provided. Bathroom very well appointed. The hotel is extremely well located for shopping, museums etc yet is very quiet. There are loads of good restaurants nearby and public transport with U and S bahn in easy walking distance. There's a big Christmas market round the corner but our friend took us to a much better one at Charlottenburg in front of the palace. We went for a walk in the park there which was deserted and then into the market at sunset - magical. I had an excellent nights sleep in a very comfortable bed. There seems to be no view whatsoever other than into an inner courtyard from most of the rooms but other than that they were really good. The spa looked great but we didn't have time to use it. Staff all friendly and helpful, especially the concierges and door staff I would completely recommend this hotel. It is a bit pricey but we got a very good deal booking early directly with the hotel Thanks Hotel de Rome for an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Get a better bartender”
Reviews.Author: McWarg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Rome offers a great location, a fine gym/spa/pool, and stylish rooms (whatever rate you are paying). It is a classic effort by Rocco Forte and yes, there were celebrities (though they were German, so we did not recognize them). There are some rooms with small terraces, but if you are there in the warm weather, the hotel has a roof terrace open to all guests. What they don’t have is a competent bartender! We settled in one night and believing, from appearances, that this hotel MUST have a good bar, worthy of some classic drinks, we ordered a Manhattan and an Old Fashioned. We waited forever for the drinks (those that arrived after us had their drinks before us) and when the drinks did arrive, the Old-Fashioned lacked bourbon and the Manhattan just tasted wrong. We were really surprised but when we told the waitress she claimed they were “German versions” of those drinks. Please…at those prices I want the American version! I hope the management takes note and sends whoever was on duty on November 13th to bartender school.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great interior & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SiljeofNorway
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the weekend at the Hotel de Rome in mid town Berlin. Hotel location is "shop in shop out"!. Bets location in on a quiet square just off the main shoppingstreet Fredirchstrasse and the famous Undter den lindten strasse. Hotel staff is exstremaly proffesional and almost over the top kind. I was espesially impressed with the consiergedesk-staff that knows every pleace and every one to get the best tickets, tabels and entrences to nightclubs etc. Hotel interior is very very nice - and rooms large & clasiic modern interior. I would rate this hotel as one of my top10 in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: j9289
Reviews.Content: We had an unforgettable experience with this very professional hotel. The location can't be beat, the staff are fabulous and the amenities first rate. There are of course less expensive options but our experience was that this hotel was well worth the cost. The concierge service was first rate, the pool was great and the roof deck (on a sunny day) just can't be beat. Also, the restaurant and the lobby bar are both very good. We'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good, mix of contemporary and...”
Reviews.Author: Clody17
Reviews.Content: Very very good, mix of contemporary and old Berlin identity. Nice Spa! Excellent location! Service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome decor with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sptl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is part of the Rocco Forte chain, which have never let me down. It is the ultimate luxury within the city of Berlin. I have been there before in 2 different hotels (Westin Berlin and Adlon Hotel) and believe me that when it comes to luxury they are not ever comparable to the hotel the Rome. Set in Bebelplatz, a beautiful square in Unter Der Linden, the hotel is actually the former Dresden Bank, so its a beautiful combination of styles in its decoration. Rooms are very big, bathrooms have antique mosaic works and very nice details. The bar on the rooftop is a must! It has one of Berlin's best views and a very comfortable chilling atmosphere. Concierge service is the best in town, they get you whatever reservation or tickets you need. I would definitely return to the Hotel de Rome on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: MKRWashington
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite hotel, good location, attentive to details, beautiful architecture and decoration, trendy but not too much, amazaing spa... perfect both for business or leisure

Reviews.Title: “Architectural Splendour with Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: luxadvisor
Reviews.Content: The summer breeze welcome us as we arrived at this historical building - was built in 1887 - 1889 from a design by the architect Ludwig Heim. Admiring the original architek of the entrance - few steps away, i cought the warm smile of the Front Desk agent - appeared neatly in her black suite uniform. The check in went smooth, my room preferrence was re-confirmed along with my room package arrangements. As she escorted us to the room, she explained also told us regarding the hotel facilities and a bit story of the hotel - was a headquarters of Dresner Bank until 1945 - no wonder the room doors, for example, are designed to be reminiscent of bank vault doors. Check in procedure = 100 % score - match the criteria of luxury hotel. Our deluxe room is overlooking to St. Hedwig's Cathedral, the dove blue color theme and its original high dimension ceiling (over 3 m) - made this 40 m2 room appear generously in size. Room are clean and well appointed - the bathroom have separate bathtubs, glass-walled shower cabin and interesting mosaic decoration. Breakfast was served at the Parioli restaurant - buffet style , the selection is great (not as sumptous as the Ritz Carlton Berlin) - but it suit to its boutique style property (146 rooms/suites). The Service at the restaurant is excellent. The agents are friendly and our empty plates were clear away before we asked for - great atttention. I love their small outdoor terrace. The spa is small but well equiped - fitness room, steam room, sauna and the swimming pool. There are complimentary refreshment at the spa , unfortunately it was not well replenished (a small point for perfection). Caught up at the shopping escapade in friedrichstrasse (which only a few blocks away) , I noticed that we were late for our afternoon tea arrangement - surprisely, they still able to serve it at the roof terrace - with a wonderful view of the city. I am sure that this property will stands out along with their sister properties in Germany (villa Kennedy frankfurt, and the charles munich).As a part of rocco forte group, which most of their property only concentrate in european market - It just a matter of time before they brench out to other continent. The next developments are in middle east. Thanks to the Great taste of the designer team Tommaso Ziffer and Olga Polizzi from which able to give a contemporary twist towards this historical building. I certainly will be back to this property again - thanks to their attentive services.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Pippi_Rome
Reviews.Content: A real gem - Rocco Forte's knows his business very well. Impeccable service and spacious lovely rooms. The spa is just great in the former caveau of DDR National bank

Reviews.Title: “Certainly 5 star, a little austere though”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated to everything. The ground was packed with snow. I stayed for 4 nights. Did some business but also saw the town. The staff are great - concierge offered to send someone to buy a 3 day DBahn pass for me! Also got me into the "new" Museum same day - almost impossible. The food and wine were first rate as was service - I ordered a glass of pinot noir in the lounge while waiting for someone - it was refilled almost without me knowing and i was only charged for the first glass. The dining area and breakfast buffet were also fantastic. The staff were like a bunch of girl next door supermodels with a freckle here and there so you were reminded they were real - efficient, personable, interactive if you wanted. The rooms are remodelled bank office and large - the design means small closets (ok for one) and big bathrooms (I suspect they vary). The corridors between the rooms have very high ceiling scream "old worlde bank". They are quite austere and could use warming up or modern art or something. The biggest negative here is the cost - online started at 400 Euros per night. This is over my academic budget level if I have to pay myself, so I probably will not get back - I have fond memories, however.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Musken
Reviews.Content: - Small classic suite, especially the bathroom was a disappointment - not at all the size and layout that I had been expecting based on photos that I had seen at their internet site. Photos of large classic suite bathroom are from the classic suites that do not have separate living/bedroom. Also wardrobe was very small with little space even for our 3-day luggage. - Great SPA area and treatments - REN products in suite - very nice. Showers in SPA (and cheaper room categories as far as I understood) has a Rocco Forte range which is also OK, but REN was of course a great plus - Great location close to lots of shopping and sightseeing opportunities - Great breakfast, but other food disappointing - Service variable, sometimes really 5 star, other times far from it - Loved look and design og common areas, but not rooms (too modern an not very comfortalble sofas and chairs) - Bed far to hard for my liking. I love the Four Seasons beds. The bed in our suite made my back hurt badly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: jack06
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Hotel. The location is fantastic, only a few minutes away from the main shopping area. The hotel itself is lovely. We had a classic room (lowest standard) and found the room size to be very good for Europe. We looked into an external courtyard, but did not expect anything else considering the grade/standard of room. Lovely Ren bathroom products, and of course the standard slippers and bathrobes are supplied. Mineral water supplied free of charge every day. The pool/spa areas is lovely (this used to be the old vault when the building was bank. Did not eat at the hotel, but the menu's looked very nice. The cocktails in the bar were first class, with complimentary nibbles in the evening. Very nice touch. Berlin is fabulous. We did two walking tours with Original Berlin Walks. Our guide Kenny was fabulous. These tours are extremely worthwhile. Also, very close to the hotel is a traditional pub, called Augustiner (Charlottenstraße 55) is excellent for traditional hearty food (sausage, schnitzel, pork knuckle etc). We went three times in three days (it's that good). Staff very friendly and English menu if required. Fabulous city, would recommend this city and this hotel - Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “3 and a Half Stars, With a Lot of Packaging”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelGuy23
Reviews.Content: Strictly mediocre hotel. I've not stayed elsewhere in Berlin, so I cannot compare. But the furnishings are worn, many of the views are of a bleak interior courtyard, the lobby stinks of cigarettes, and the hallways exude all the charm of a Holiday Inn outside Fresno. Really nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “It is not a design hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lugageboy
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. The service was excellent. Unfortunately the rooms doesn't live up to the reputation, they are quite dull and could be compared to a nice business hotel. Maybe an older audience would find Hotel de Rome a good experience. One odd thing is that they close the lounge area around six o'clock in the evening - a room that has a quit cool design; the design you hoped to find inside the rooms - wich means that if you want to read a book outside the room or just chill you can only go to the bar.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location You Can Find in Berlin...”
Reviews.Author: lucasprague
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful trip to Germany's capital. We have the luck to stay in a "piece" of luxurious Rocco Forte Collection and if you have some money to spend, definitely pick Hotel de Rome, located right in the heart of Berlin next to famous Unter den Linden which allows you to walk everywhere around...Front office very friendly, Concierge very well informed and extremely helpful, housekeeping attentive and the swimming pool, sauna and steam bath - just gorgeous after whole day walking in rain...

Reviews.Title: “The best, by far, luxury hotel in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: nikostsepetis
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel. It has everything: top location, staff super friendly and always available to help, chic interiors, smart bar, good spa. I will happily return back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Precision Luxury for Private People”
Reviews.Author: Eastberlin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at Hotel de Rome. The location is outstanding - walking distance to key central buildings, museums and sites - yet much more private than other luxury hotels in central Berlin. The entrance is low-key and not a mass of huddled tourists. The doormen, porters and staff remember your name and service is spot-on. It might go without saying, but "spot-on" service in Germany might come across just a bit cold to non-Germans, but the important thing is the staff at this hotel does not miss a beat. If you're a fan of the 4pm "high tea" the one served at this hotel is outstanding. In terms of the experience, this is not a hotel bubbling with activity and excitement. You may feel like the most important guest in the hotel, but then again you may feel like the only guest. It's private, luxurious and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lettersfromlondon
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Berlin to visit a friend and wanted to stay in a chic hotel in a central location. My friend advised the Rome, saying it was the 'in' place in Berlin right now and that lots of famous people hung out in the hotel bar. I'm not averse to a bit of Claudia Shiffer spotting, but mostly it was the idea of a stylish well located boutique hotel that appealed to me. I booked a 'standard' room via the internet, thinking I should keep costs low, well, relatively speaking. I was suprised and delighted to find that my standard room was large and spacious and the bathroom a dream come true. Big, with a great shower and bath, a powerful hairdryer, plus all those lovely free cosmetics hotels of this calibre come with. The Rome is super modern but manages to still be very comfortable with a luxurious feel, in the way that some of the Schrager hotels fail. One of the best features for me (aside from the great bathroom) is that in the mornings the hotel was wonderfully quiet. Some places, despite being pricey, have an irritating array of vacuming and cleaning noises in the passages outside your room making it difficult to have a well deserved lie-in. Which is what holidays are all about right? The staff were very helpful and responsive and not in the least bit snooty. My husband regularly stays in the Adlon for business and I've told him he needs to try the the Rome asap because I know he will love it. I'd advise trying one of the online booking sites to get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning but expensive”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is actually part of an old bank, with a gorgeous facade exuding charm and grace. Absolutely stunning. The interior is very nicely decorated, very classy ambience with top quality furnshings and wide corridors. There's a beautiful heated pool and well equipped gym with fruit and water. Arrived by taxi and the doorman already knew my name - no doubt he has a list of guests and their ETAs but still pretty impressive. The location is brilliant, 15 mins stroll to the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag and Berlin Tower; around the corner from shops like Galeries Lafayette and 5 mins to a bunch of musuems. No problems with taxis as they wait outside at all hours. Friendly and efficient check-in and escorted to a room with abysmal views of the other side of the U shaped building. This meant little natural light and no view, which was very disappointing but rooms facing the front wont have this issue. The classic room was large, with soaring high ceilings and was obviously touched by fancy interior decorators. The TV gives access to an extensive inbuilt CD library and free internet access to some email sites. The bed was some distance from the TV however so it wouldnt hurt to get a bigger TV. The "King" bed was actually two singles pushed together, very comfortable but rather disappointing and not what you would expect. Bathroom was impressive, stunning design with beautiful marble everywhere, heated floors and a vanity mirror that stays constantly illuminated. Water pressure was great but the temperature seemed to be limited to scaldingly hot or ice cold with not much in between. Generic toiletries are disapppointing though. Breakfast was great, a nice buffet selection of cold items of the highest quality and a la carte hot items. Fresh and tasty. Service was excellent, staff at the restaurant during breakfast were outstanding, friendly and extremely efficient without being intrusive, addressing you by name at all times. In fact you are constantly addressed by name by almost everyone; I couldnt care less but its a nice gesture and some divas demand it. The younger staff were very warm and friendly while the older ones seemed stiff and somewhat cold . The clientle is mostly old money so that might explain their stuffy nature, or maybe they dont like younger guests. The rooftop bar gives (surprising since its only on the 4th floor) stunning views and drinks at equally stunning prices, but closes at 10.30pm which is a pity, since the sun only sets an hour before. Definitely worth a visit though for some great vistas of Berlin as the sun sets. A stunning hotel with beautiful, cosy and extremely comfortable rooms. The only downside was the price, and being stuck with views of a wall at these prices. Having to pay extra for internet, tea and coffee etc after the hefty rate is also annoying and somewhat petty. Some fruit or chocolates would have been nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy
Reviews.Content: Plenty of pros with barely any cons. The pros - The hotel is located in former East Berlin near Checkpoint Charlie, the new Jewish holocaust memorial and right next to the Opera house and walking distance to the famous Brandenberg gate. The north facing rooms have a nice view of the plaza adjacent to the opera house. The room (206) itself is very spacious with an expansive bathroom that includes a bidet, separate shower and bath tub. Unlike a previous traveler, found the shower temperature to be perfect with copious amounts of water. Bed too was a proper king mattress. Plenty of TV channels to choose from for those supinely inclined. The entire staff is extremely well trained and very courteous starting from bell staff to housekeeping attendants. The waitstaff is no less with most going the extra mile to cater to food preferences. The cons are the extras as has been stated in other reviews - 20 euros for using the internet - a bit of a rip-off that leaves a bad taste as well as charges for using AT&T USA direct which really is no skin off the hotel's nose.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but not the perfection you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Morda
Reviews.Content: Beautiful women usually don’t have great personalities. They can rely on their looks, so they don’t need to be particularly intelligent, funny or interesting. Plain-looking women, on the other hand, usually figure out that they need to have a great personality if they want anyone to pay attention to them. The combination of both beauty and depth is rare and narrowly escapes the Hotel de Rome in Berlin. On questions of design and aesthetics the hotel is difficult to fault. Its designers have seamlessly converted a chunky old bank (and filming location of the movie Run Lola Run) into a sleek modern luxury hotel. A magnificently-lighted pool, spa and ample fitness facilities occupy the former vaults in the basement. Our room’s design and layout were also effortless, modern and stylish. The beauty is apparent at first glance and never fades. Then you get to know her a little better, and the Hotel de Rome begins to disappoint. Underneath the bedspread are two twin mattresses pushed together, not a single king. In the bathroom, the marble, mosaic tiles, large bathtub, heated mirror and ingenious toilet-paper dispenser are delightful touches. But they are overshadowed by the shower’s reluctance to provide more than lukewarm water, even when ample hot water is available from other faucets. The Italian food is colorful and flavorful whether served in the restaurant or promptly in the room. But characteristically, the vermicelli with shrimp lacks meat and substance, with only a single prawn perched on a bed of pasta. With passive-aggressive flair, the room service staff never fails to ask when they should return to retrieve your tray, and then consistently fails to actually return. It’s unfair to cite that single example because the hotel staff was usually extremely courteous, helpful and unobtrusive. But sharing a bathroom proved complicated when the cleaning personnel left a bottle of cleaning fluid next to my mouthwash. Finally, it became frustrating to be asked to pay for every little thing, particularly internet and phone at unreasonable prices (20€/day and 2.50€/call to a free 08 prefix, respectively). Even when paying with company money, a twinge of guilt accompanies the use of these basic services. When will luxury hotels realize that these services are, in the 21st century, analogous to indoor toilets in the early 20th century? Just as we don’t worry about fees to use the toilet, we should not have to deal with fees for basic communication services, particularly in luxury hotels that should make life easier. Despite the imperfections under the surface, the Hotel de Rome is a beauty and worth the visit. After all, nobody’s perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: undertone
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel de Rome: (1) perfect location - convenient yet removed from the hubbub of Unter der Linden; (2) beautiful, large room (we booked deluxe double and were first shown to a courtyard view, but were graciously shown to a similarly sized room with a wonderful view of the Berliner Dome, the television tower and St Hedwig's Church) with wonderful bathroom with large tub and separate shower; (3) excellent service - friendly, informative, and not too formal; (4) and fantastic spa and pool area. We have also stayed at the highly rated Hotel 1898 in Barcelona and the Gresham Palace in Budapest - both of which the Hotel de Rome is somewhat reminiscent - converted historic buildings, modern furnishings, etc, but much preferred the Hotel de Rome - it gets everything right. Ranks right up there with our favorite European hotels - the Sacher, the Berkeley, and the Ritz in Paris, and is relatively well-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good on the whole few things to sort out for a smooth stay”
Reviews.Author: Chavtrav
Reviews.Content: First impressions are good - externally big imposing building- the lobby very attractive (the building is an old bank) and large with lots of marble, staff are attentive and friendly. Checked in and they acknowledged I'd stayed before. Rooms are quite dark (I stayed in a classic room) but this is down to the decor which is on the whole quite nice (modern)...beautiful bathrooms (love the rain fall shower) had a bit of a flood due to drain being a little blocked but very nice housekeeping manager sorted it.....very comfy beds and pillows - linen sheets. TV set up is annoying - you can't just switch on and view a channel have to go through this whole 'entertainment' Rocco Forte system - really annoying and only CNN and BBC world for the UK. No ipod dock - would've been a nice touch. You'd expect a bit more state of the art judging by the rest of the hotel, i.e. some Bang & Olufson wouldn't be out of place. View into an office bit strange. Spa extortionate. Very attractive pool etc though. Food very nice (I wasn't immediately grabbed by anything on menu however everything I had was very good indeed). The staff in this hotel (and in all Rocco Forte properties in my experience) are very well trained - helpful and friendly. Prices in the bar are over the top with cheapest bottle of wine approx €36. Recommeded a restaurant by concierge. Food v good there but service bad and upon receiving the bill we discovered they didn't take credit cards and so we had to scrabble around to get enough money to pay - this included a colleague being directed to nearest cashpoint (described as very close) 15 min walk away!! Overall good but tried to charge me twice for the rooms when I checked out - and this happened when I stayed there previously in 2007!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very interesting city”
Reviews.Author: bobd72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to go to Berlin for a quick weekend trip...The hotel was a quick taxi ride from the airport...The hotel was very centrally located, a 10 minute walk from Museum Island and the Brandenbourg Gate...Inside the hotel was relatively modern but not minimalist...There were a lot of deep colors and dark woods and the building acted as the former headquarters of a bank...The rooms were spacious and furnished with contemporary furniture...There is also a roof top terrace and a very nice spa/fitness center...The staff was helpful and efficient and the concierge staff knowledgable...The hotel was great for a weekend break and I could not imagine staying anywhere else in Berlin...Berlin is very interesting and offers an effective balance between a vibrant new capital and a city filled with culture and history.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely gem of a hotel for a family winter break”
Reviews.Author: sbenemer
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin for the purpose of sampling Germany's Christmas markets in Dec 2008. We have a 3yr and a then-3month old so any mini-break choice would have to be carefully thought out. The Hotel de Rome impressed us by its friendliness and enthusiasm about hosting our young children. We booked directly with the hotel's staff, who excitedly told us about their children's program. The location of the hotel in Mitte (old East Berlin, now the museum hub of the city) was fantastic; it was within a 5 minute walk of two of the best christmas markets, including a charming one in beautiful Gendarmenmarkt. Near the hotel was one of Berlin's upscale shopping avenues, for those needing a break from the museums. The Brandenburg Tor and several other famous Berlin sites were only 20-30 minutes by foot, in all a great location. The hotel lobby impressed us with its luxe feel. It was more "quiet sophistication" than business hotel atmostphere. The high ceilings of the old bank building site were breathtaking and the parlour for tea/breakfast was lovely. Staff were so friendly and went out of their way to fuss over the kids. The kids club is new so will need tweaking, and is targeted towards older kids. THey had special classes, including cookie baking, which a 5-10 year old bracket would enjoy. The staff dropped off cookies with our children's names spelled out and candies on individual plates. My husband and I enjoyed sampling them, in lieu of our 3month old. The room had an enormous bed and even with a crib for our toddler, it was spacious for the four of us. Top notch finishings in the room too, again more quiet luxury. In all, this was a lovely, sophisticated hotel that would appeal to couples, business travelers and yes, even young families on a short weekend break looking for an elegant, enjoyable place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “stay in a bank”
Reviews.Author: saintvalentine
Reviews.Content: This is a very agreable hotel in a perfect position if visiting the main museums of Berlin is your intention. The rooms are huge and very well appointed, but the public spaces are too empty and barren to be welcoming. This is very much a business hotel - I can't image it as a suitable one for family visits.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as is always with Rocco Forte”
Reviews.Author: Elena1111
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, building, inner design, service, food-simply excellent

Reviews.Title: “Simple luxury”
Reviews.Author: PortoTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with Hotel de Rome from the moment I spotted it down the street. Set in a beautiful square in a very impressive and grand palladian building which used to be a bank it makes an immediate impact. The public areas are impeccably appointed in grey, brown and black colors with classic contemporary art-deco influenced furnishings that really do the large scale halls justice. My classic room was huge, beautifully decorated in red and black, and very comfortable. The bathrooms, evoking Rome with their mosaics and marble walls, were perfectly equipped. The pool was magnificent, if a bit cold. Breakfast was absolutely worth the price: I was particularly impressed with the array of smoked meats, cheese and breads, and the delicious exquisite jams. The service was top-notch in all aspects. The concierge's many advice on restaurants and shops were priceless. The maids meticulously displayed my personal beauty products and utensils on a clean towel beside the wash bin. The sympathy and attention to detail was constant throughout. The downside was the lack of jacuzzi in the spa, and the charged internet (20 Euros per day).

Reviews.Title: “Worth visiting Berlin for”
Reviews.Author: UKgooner
Reviews.Content: Among the best hotels I have stayed in. The rooms are spacious, well designed, and although modern, a pleasure to be in. A fantastic health club, and brilliant staff. It is expensive, but I didn't regret a cent

Reviews.Title: “5 star with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: TwoHavlesofCoconuts
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel de Rome on business. I normally stay at the Hilton which is a good 4 star hotel by US standards. The Hotel de Rome is a full notch higher. It is a 5 star hotel by US standards. The service is top notch. You are walked to your room and shown and amenities. You are also shown around when you visit the spa. I interacted with several employees, one was a snob, the others friendly and respectful. My room was fairly large with a contemporary design, new furnishings and very clean. The room was very quiet (not surprising being an inner room). There were three issues I had with the room: 1. There is no iron. It costs 6.5 Euros to have a shirt pressed. If you come is late at night with an early morning meeting, this could be a problem. I always think it is a bit of a scam not to provide guests with an iron, in addition to being a pain. 2. There is no alarm clock so you have no idea what time it is during the night (the clock on the TV goes off when turned off) and you have to use wake up service. The front desk attendant seemed very surprised when I suggested it would be nice to include an alarm clock in the room. 3. The hotel was formerly a bank and the bank design, particularly the large halls, gives it a certain grandeur. There is a problem with this however, when you stay in an inner room. There are a couple of atriums which gives the inner rooms light. The rooms are at two ends with large hallways on each side (perpendicular to the rooms). The hallways have windows which allow a line of sight into your room. Thus, you will have to decide whether you want light or privacy. Not a choice you should have to make in a 5 star hotel. I would not stay there again if I had to have an inner room. The spa also has a modern design. The gym is furnished with high end equipment including treadmills, cycles and stair climbers. There are only three types of weight machines (chest press, leg press and shoulder press) which only perform one type of exercise so a full weights workout on machines is not possible. There are dumbbells but no other free weights. The room is very small but it was empty when I was there. The indoor pool area is also very small with one 20m lane to swim. I do not think there is any food/drink service in the pool area. The water was pretty chilly. The steam room is small and okay, the sauna nicer. The gym is provided with robes and slippers. The food was very good (surprisingly well prepared), albeit pricey, and arrived quickly when I ordered room service.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: ICSAESJA
Reviews.Content: Did not have a 100% satisfying experience staying at Rocco Forte's The Charles Hotel (Munich) this May, but still wanted to try the Hotel de Rome in Berlin. I have been to many good hotels around the globe (Four Seasons, Aman resorts, Ritz Carltons, Park Hyatts....) but my stay at the Hotel de Rome was among the best hotel experiences I've ever had. The hotel and especially the entire staff they have in Berlin make a guest feel very much at home from the very first second he comes to the Hotel de Rome. It starts with a nice door man, goes on with a super friendly check in service, a perfect demonstration of the room, charming staff in the spa, delicious food for dinner, great breakfast and a highly professional and warm service at the restaurant. Also in the bar and on the roof top terrace I was so happy with Massimo and his staff's service. Very attentive and nice at every minute. I loved the rooms, since they are so tasteful, more stylish than Munich, clean and well maintained as if they are brand new. During my stay I never wanted to leave the hotel because it has such a nice atmosphere and I was really sad to leave. In my opinion it's the staff that makes the difference between a very good hotel stay and a fantastic hotel stay. In Berlin they have the best staff I have seen in a long time. Warm smiles and highly professional people all over the place. You can see that they like working there. Congrats on the person who selects them and a big, big THANK YOU to all of them from me ;-) Not to forget the location that could not be any better in Berlin. In the middle of everything, with stunning views from the roof top terrace and yet quiet and away from the hussle and buzzle.. Cannot wait for my next stay in October.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service, Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: guidebook_junkie
Reviews.Content: The concierge at the Hotel de Rome (Anne), rescued our European vacation. We have stayed at very nice hotels in cities all over the world, and the Hotel de Rome definitely is at the top of the list in terms of rooms, amenities, location (all top-notch), but what truly separated this Hotel and makes us de Rome apostles is the truly amazing service, hospitality and warmth of the concierge (Anne--pronounced Anna if you go to see her). Our vacation got off to a rocky start because some of our luggage was lost. Anne went above and beyond in helping us by putting us at ease that we would find it, she called the airport more than necessary to track it down, and had it delivered to our room...all while trying to come up with suggestions for relaxing things to do while we waited for the luggage to arrive. After that hurdle was passed, she continued to help truly make our stay in Berlin amazing by recommending great restaurants (even though we're not their typical clientele....we're a younger lesbian couple as opposed to the business-type older men and couples and fancy American families that we came across there). At no time did we feel that we received less attention or service when asking for a great Vietnamese noodle shop for reservations vs. a Michelin - starred restaurant. Need a wine shop? Done. Need bikes? Done and done. Compared to other front desk and concierge services during the rest of our stay...well, it just doesn't compare. Here's another ridiculous example of their great service: We asked for rush laundry service since we only had a couple of articles of clothing, and they quickly obliged. When we looked around and saw that the fee would be outrageous (70 Euro) for a few pieces of clothes, we asked them to cancel, and they agreed. Instead of canceling the service, they finished laundering, and took the fee off our bill. There's a reason you pay up a little bit (and by the way, we paid much less than the rate advertised on their website by booking through Expedia--a rate also available on Tablethotels), but in return, you get so much more. Not only would I recommend this hotel to anyone who will listen...I would return to Berlin...endure 20 hours of flying...just to stay here again. The only small very minor points that I can complain about (oh so minor), are that they could have a little bit more thorough gym equipment, and ditch the scratchy linen sheets. But everything else was splendid!!!! (We had drinks at the bar and watched football and chatted w/ the bartender....the list goes on and on)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but great!”
Reviews.Author: WaldronofLondon
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel - quietly located in the Mitte district (within what used to be East Berlin), opposite a quiet square and Humboldt Univ. About 10 minutes walk from Brandenburg Gate, about 10 minutes walk from Museum Island, about 15 minutes by taxi to Kunst Forum where the superb and newly built Gemaldegalerie and Neue National Galerie have excellent art collections. About 20 minutes from Tegel airport by taxi at 6pm in the evening (cost E20 which we thought very reasonable) and about 40 minutes from Schonefeld airport (cost us E40 to get there for our return flight). Much larger hotel than the other Rocco Forte hotel we have visited (Savoy in Florence). Also has outside space (4th floor terrace and bar) which was much appreciated as weather was in the high 80s (in May!!) Extremely stylishly decorated, pleasant bar with live music in the evenings, extensive (but expensive) breakfast buffet. We had lunch there too in the Parioli restaurant (Italian) - very good. In room internet is expensive E20 per 24 hours. Wifi downstairs free of charge but did not try this (if you are on business, you will be in your room!). We had deluxe rooms - extremely large and airy. Not sure I would pay the extra as we heard standard rooms are pretty good too, and we did not spend long in the rooms. Bathroom was perfect - up to date, absolutely clean, and separate shower and bath. We paid E400 per night including breakfast so we had high expectations. Did not visit the Spa. Staff a mix of other Europeans and Germans - without exception they were friendly and pleasant. In the vicinity, there is the Michelin starred Vau restaurant (rather expensive but with a pleasant courtyard for warm evening dining) about 5 minutes walk. Other restaurants a short walk away - mixed quality. Concierge gives good advice. Not perhaps the most exciting place for younger people to stay (no local buzz) but extremely comfortable for middle aged folk. Those of us who like swirly carpets and "traditional" decor might be better off at the Adlon but we would certainly return if in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent RF as good as ever”
Reviews.Author: markq3
Reviews.Content: We used to love the Forte hotels and some how Rocco Forte carries on where they were when taken over. We have stayed at a few RF hotels and they have the same ambience; you feel like you are staying with family or good friends - but the service is first class!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: travellingchefLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 1 night only but wished it could have been longer. Arrived at 4am ! and was warmly welcomed including hot coffee and warm pastries waiting in my room...now that is service. I have stayed at a number of the Forte collection hotels and this one has stunning public areas, very smart indeed. Room was quiet and simply furnished but still luxurious. Sadly didn't have a chance to try the restaurants or bar this visit but the staff i did meet were helpful and friendly. Perfect location for a weekend break, will make sure I return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but Overpriced Services”
Reviews.Author: ly74girl
Reviews.Content: We travel to Berlin annually to visit family and usually stay at our relatives' houses. However, we decided to get some private time and are so glad we chose this hotel. It is located in a great location. The decor is done flavorfully well and extremely modern. Bed is absolutely comfortable. Our bedroom window looked out into the interior courtyard though and people walking down the corridor could see into our bedroom if we didn't have the shades down. Bathroom is extremely spacious and clean. Bar downstairs is great for visitors. Internet is charged which is ridiculous. I had a basic mani/pedi and it cost $225.00. Too much. Otherwise, it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bertorelli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 13 year old son for four nights in January. It was my first experience of a Rocco Forte hotel and I can't wait for the next, it may even be Hotel de Rome again. We were upgraded to a junior suite on arrival and it just kept getting better and better. The beds are great. The breakfast is exceptional with a huge array of fruits , fantastic bread, bircher muesli, meats, cheeses, juices, smoked salmon, great coffee and a huge selection of teas. The spa is really great and when we were there it was practically empty. But best of all is the concierge service which is the most helpful I have ever come across. Get them to make restaurant bookings for you and I heartily recommend San Nicci on Friedrichstrasse and Nola's am Weinberg in the park on Veteranerstrasse for the best authentic brunch among the beautiful people of Berlin. Also go on a walking tour with New Berlin Walking tours. They start in Pariserplatz outside Starbucks and are a fantastic, moving and funny introduction to this great city

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for service and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Renard123
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my husband for 3 nights on a recommendation from a friend who does a lot of business travel in Berlin. This was a genuine 5 star experience with one of the best concierge services I've experienced.
