Charming young Welsh concierge spent at least 20 minutes advising us on getting around and making recommendations for restaurants. Decor is modern, minimalist but very dramatic and attractive. We were upgraded to a superior (De Luxe) room overlooking the square, which was very quiet. Both room and bathroom sizes were huge, very comfortable bed and top class bathroom fittings including double walk-in shower. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, but did stop a while at the very trendy bar with pianist and singer where the beautiful people seemed to congregate. Overall a lovely, city hotel with discreet and very knowledgeable staff, but not at all pompous or stuffy. Would highly recommend the Hotel de Rome and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding Rocco Forte experience”
Reviews.Author: BerlinDrew
Reviews.Content: Outstanding stay. I have also stayed at the Rocco Forte Villa Kennedy in Frankfurt, and was very impressed with both. In Berlin, this spanking new hotel features a stunning marble entryway, wonderful room, and excellent, professional, fast service. Everything was solid and new, but nothing felt too "slick". All service experiences were fast, friendly and perfect. There is currently some construction going on in the street in front, but not an issue (although I don't think my room faced it). The hotel is very close to many of the key museums and momuments. A few notes: high-speed internet in the room is LAN, and not free. Valet parking may be required; I'm not sure but the valet said "We would like to park your car for you." I didn't mind, so I didn't dig into whether I could park it myself if desired. Room service food quality was good, but not great, and the menu fairly limited (I recall the same at the Villa Kennedy). I stayed on a Friday, and was upgrade to a Junior Suite (which is really just a big room with a hallway) so keep that in mind if viewing the pictures. I would readily recommend this hotel for a relaxing, city weekend escape!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: richeyint
Reviews.Content: Hotel the Rome opened recently and I had a great experience. The staff was all so friendly and eficient. The rooms are great and the bathroom floor heated which I loved. I will defenetly return!

Reviews.Title: “de Rome”
Reviews.Author: GeneDC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day New Year's trip to Berlin and stayed at the brand new Hotel de Rome. Having just opened one month ago, the hotel is still working out the "newness" of its staff. Location is superb- right on the Bebelplatz- just steps from the Opera and all the major historic museums. Just around corner from the Regent and the close to the main shopping areas. Great dining nearby at Lutter & Wegner, Boca di Bacco and drinks at Newton bar. Our conceirge staff was excellent- made all our bookings and confirmed all on line. Rooms were spotless, immaculate (new), we had a deluxe room - spacious, modern- great bathroom with all the amenities. Flat screen plasma TV's- limited English speaking stations (CNN, MSNBC, BBCnews), unfortunately no CD player although the TV has an available music playlist (too bad you can't dim/ turn off the monitor). Request room on floor 1 and 2 beautiful high ceilings. Pool, sauna, spa- Ok if fee is included in your rate--small pool, good workout equipment. Difficult top boook treatments due to limited staff--- Restaurant staff was excellent, outgoing- menus are limited. Lunch in restautant is Italian and limited to a more formal experience. Dining with children can be difficult here as the options are limited. Room service menu however was wonderful and service EXCELLENT. I usually avoid room service except at breakfast but did eat in on arrival night due to luggage not arriving. Hopefully they will expand their menu options.in the restaurant. In contrast to other RF hotels I've visited , the staff at the de Rome was a bit more formal--perhaps they are being cautious in their initial days. I am sure as their confidence grows their service will become more natural. What's needed to make it truly exceptional is the human touch. A true gem!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: EmilyNH
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel and thought it was perfect. it is in a great location in the old east berlin amongst some of the most beautiful buildings and it is easy to get elsewhere. the hotel is luxurious without being pretentious and the service is second to none. each and every one of the staff went out of their way to help us and welcome us we had a room on the second floor and it was fabulous. it was a standard room but immacualte. the bed was comfy and the bathroom gorgeous plus a huge walk in wardrobe the spa was a bonus and very quiet in the evening the food in the restaurant was stunning. my only gripe would be that the resturant doesn;t have much atmosphere and the lighting is dreadful overall - wonderful

Reviews.Title: “trendy designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheerprom
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 2 nights at Hotel de Rome,Berlin with my husband who was on a business trip. It had only been open 6 weeks and so there were some minor teething troubles such as the TV internet facilities not working. Bedroom very comfortable but the duvet was heavy and it was too hot to sleep - there were no alternative bed coverings available. Also the pillows whilst being of the highest quality were too thick for my liking. The aircon was difficult to work out as there were no temperature markings and it was not possible to open the window only a little. The bathroom was very luxurious but the towels did not smell that fresh. The decor of the hotel is minimalist and beautifully colour coordinated. We had dinner in the dining room with guests and although the 'italian' food was of a very high standard, we were surprised to be charge over 80 euros for 7 bottles of mineral water! Breakfast is charged extra and you can help yourself from the buffet for 19 euros or have cooked stuff as well for 26 euros. Fantastic buffet of best quality cheese, meat, salmon, breads, cakes, fresh berries, cereals, juices etc. We did not use the spa but the water in the pool was warm. Good location in beautiful building with helpful staff.
